description:
1. Prologue: Introduction to Data Cloud & Data in the Cloud

   • Data Cloud Layers[http://bit.ly/6rrhfV]
   • Introduction to NOSQL

2. NOSQL Architectures, Internals & Algorithmics

   • A quick look at the mechanics of implementations incl. CAP Theorem and impacts there of, memTables, partition mechanisms (regions et al), vector clocks, gossip protocols and so forth

3. Deep Dive into the broad types of NOSQL applications & datastores

   • Key-value Store
   • Graph Database
   • Data structure server
   • Document store
   • Wide column store

4. Hands-on coding examples on three types of NOSQL Datastores

   • Table/Column (HBase/Cassandra)
   • Document (CouchDB/MongoDB)
   • Graph(Neo4j)

5. Epilogue

Notes:    • As this is a tutorial, it should be broad as well as deep. With that in mind, we will discuss the NOSQL domain, the underpinnings, common algorithmics and dive into the general types
   • We will follow the polyglot programming – choosing the language that fits the task from Java, Ruby and Scala
   • There will be hands-on homework! We plan to setup instances for you to get hands-on experience during the rest of OSCON
   • Two related tutorials: a. Neo4j b. Cassadra
title: Building a NoSQL Data Cloud
